intro: Ditassa imbricata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, long-lasting flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of 10–30 cm. Its leaves are arranged in a rosette pattern, and the flowers are borne on tall, slender stalks. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
